byline.contributor: This article was produced in collaboration with The Marshall Project, a nonprofit news organization that focuses on criminal justice issues.
byline.original: By TOM ROBBINS and LAUREN D'AVOLIO

abstract: Attica Correctional Facility guards Sean Warner, Keith Swack and Matthew Rademacher plead guilty to misdemeanor charge of misconduct in severe 2011 beating of inmate George Williams; Williams, who suffered broken legs, broken ribs, broken shoulder and other injuries, has filed civil rights lawsuit against guards, who are spared jail time from plea deal in exchange for being barred from working in prison system.
lead_paragraph: The correction officers at the western New York prison, who were accused of beating an inmate, made last-minute plea deals to a misdemeanor misconduct charge.

headline.main: 3 Attica Guards Resign in Deal to Avoid Jail
headline.print_headline: Attica Guards Resign in Deal to Avoid Jail

snippet: The correction officers at the western New York prison, who were accused of beating an inmate, made last-minute plea deals to a misdemeanor misconduct charge.
